item.title: Wall Street today: S&P 500, Nasdaq hit record high as jobs data bolsters hopes for Fed rate cut

review.headline_rewrite: Wall Street today: S&P 500, Nasdaq hit record high as jobs data bolsters hopes for Fed rate cut
bullets: In the bond market, the yield on the 10-year Treasury fell to 4.08% from 4.17% late on Thursday.
The 2-year Treasury yield declined to 3.48% from 3.59%.
Broadcom stock jumped 10.3% after the chipmaker reported stronger quarterly profit and revenue.
Smith & Wesson Brands stock soared 10.5% after the gun maker reported better quarterly results than expected.

G-Sec yields got a leg up on Thursday as fears of the government borrowing more to overcome revenue shortfall due to GST rate cut
Yield of the 10-year G-Sec thawed about 2 bps to 6.47 per cent on Friday, tracking decline in US Treasury yields.
will be positive for G-Sec yields.
